item.title: My Husband Became the Most Powerful Minister
item.nameextend: ***"Don't you want to get used to it?"***
item.description:
At the princessâ€™s banquet, in a secluded hall, Helan Ci pressed her palm against the wall, encountering the equally disheveled newly crowned top scholar Lu Wuyou. One was as delicate as a willow, the other had a flushed face.

Their eyes met, and in each otherâ€™s gaze, they saw a glimmer of despair.
â€œIâ€™ll go firstâ€¦â€
â€œIâ€™ll head that wayâ€¦â€

However, what was even more despairing was the sound of the princessâ€™s maid and the second princeâ€™s attendant searching for them not far away.
Helan Ci bit her lip: â€œWhat donâ€™t you just go to the princess?â€
Lu Wuyou endured: â€œI think the second prince is not bad either.â€
Helan Ci: â€œIf we keep talking, weâ€™ll only end up hurting each other!â€
Lu Wuyou closed his eyes: â€œThen let it be a mutual destruction.â€
Helan Ci: â€œâ€¦?â€

A night later, their innocence was lost, and they were forced into marriage. Yet, with strong enemies lurking, this marriage was extremely difficult. On one side, there was the second prince, eagerly awaiting her husbandâ€™s demise, and on the other, the princess, watching her with cold eyes.
Helan Ci asked, â€œâ€¦Can you handle this?â€
Lu Wuyou replied, â€œEven if I canâ€™t, I have to. Who told me to marry youâ€” Iâ€™m going to be a powerful minister. I canâ€™t fall here.â€
Helan Ci, â€œThen do your best! Iâ€™m counting on you!â€
Lu Wuyou, â€œâ€¦?â€

Years later, Lu Wuyou became the Prime Minister, holding the highest position among officials, wielding immense power across the land, and reflecting on the past.

A student asked him how he had come this far.

Prime Minister Lu thought to himself that as long as one marries a wife of extraordinary beauty, often coveted by others, it would always inspire one to strive to make progress.

item.title: Transmigrated into the Villain's Cannon Fodder Ex-Wife (Transmigrated into a Book)
item.description:
Lin Chu, an engineering student, was following a novel and found the villain character especially compelling. When she read the part where the villain was forced to marry a manipulative woman during his downfall, Lin Chu couldnâ€™t help but criticize the green tea character.

Who would have expected that sheâ€™d black out, only to become that very same troublesome woman who regretted her marriage to the villain on their wedding day and ultimately got herself killed?

Lin Chu: â€œâ€¦â€

Stay calm, donâ€™t panic.

Looking at the villainous husband, injured and returning from the battlefield, Lin Chu thought she had found her chance to escape her tragic fate by clinging to his leg for survivalâ€¦

item.title: The Foolish General's Mute Spouse
item.nameextend: ***Fainting from Anger***
item.description:
General Qi Ren, known as the â€œMad Wolfâ€ was once an undefeated war god. However, he was poisoned by an enemy spy on the battlefield, which left him mentally impaired, leading to the tragic downfall of a legendary hero. The Emperor, relieved to have neutralized this formidable threat to his throne, felt a twinge of guilt. Hearing rumors that the â€œmadmanâ€ harbored affection for the timid and mute Seventh Prince, Fu Yuâ€™an, the Emperor decided to arrange their marriage, believing it to be a benevolent gesture.

However, after the wedding, Fu Yuâ€™an, who had to play both father and mother to the seemingly foolish general, was shocked when he saw the â€œmadmanâ€ climbing into his bed with clear, calculating eyes. Fu Yuâ€™an kicked him off and exclaimed, â€œYouâ€™re not a fool?â€

To which Qi Ren retorted, â€œAnd youâ€™re not mute, are you? Weâ€™re both hiding our true selvesâ€”so why the disdain?â€

â€œâ€¦â€

item.title: Fever Break
item.nameextend: ***Will you be my girlfriend?***
item.description:
Everyone knows that during their college years, the campus heartthrob Shen Yixi pampered Lu Wuke to the heavens, but now he doesnâ€™t even glance at Lu Wuke.

Later, while playing truth or dare, Shen Yixi chose truth.

The class monitor asked, â€œIs there someone you canâ€™t let go of?â€

Shen Yixi smiled slightly, quite calmly: â€œNo.â€

Lu Wukeâ€™s nose twitched, and her heart ached with discomfort for a second; this person will no longer tolerate her bad temper.

That very night, a friend saw Shen Yixi drinking himself into a stupor.

The man shook the bottle of alcohol and chuckled helplessly, â€œWhat a waste of pain*.â€

I canâ€™t even bring myself to talk to her when I see her.

*It was all in vain

The story is divided to two arcs

Chapter 1 & 2 is the prolog

Chapter 3 to 55 ; The glorious days of youth [the past]

Chapter 56 to 105; Red Bean [present days]

Three chapters will be made free weekly (every Thursday, saturday, and sunday).

item.title: The Young Marquis Regrets Too Late
item.nameextend: ***Extra 1***
item.description:
Jiang Jingchun, who was the cherished daughter of a ministerâ€™s household, grew up as a true pampered young miss. She could have whatever she desired, except for one thing: her cousin, Gu Huaisheng, the young marquis of a marquisâ€™ residence.

Gu Huaisheng, who was the son of a marquisâ€™ household, was like snow on the eaves or the moon outside the windowâ€”elegant, untouchable, and the most outstanding young man in his family. He was far beyond anyoneâ€™s reach.

Jiang Jingchun tried everything to win his favour. She found out the type of person he seemed to admire and transformed herself from an outspoken and willful young lady into someone obedient and meek in his presence.

Yet no matter how hard she tried, Gu Huaisheng would barely spare her a glance.

The frustrated and desperate Jiang Jingchun followed a terrible idea from her closest friend. One day, while he wasnâ€™t paying attention, she leaned in to kiss his cheek. But just as she moved closer, Gu Huaisheng turned his head, and their lips accidentally metâ€¦

The soft touch of their lips startled her, but before Jiang Jingchun could even blush, Gu Huaisheng shoved her away harshly. With a cold and angry glare, he spat, â€œShameless,â€ and strode away without a backward glance.

That one push left Jiang Jingchun completely stunned and shattered her girlish infatuation into pieces.

Misfortunes never come singly. On the same day, news arrived at the ministerâ€™s household: the true daughter of their family had been found.

Jiang Jingchun had lived as the familyâ€™s treasured daughter for over a decade. Only then did she learn that she was, in fact, a fake daughter.

At the true daughterâ€™s formal recognition banquet, Jiang Jingchun witnessed something that cut deeper than anything before. Gu Huaisheng, who had always been cold and distant to her, now stood before the true daughter and treated her gently and warmly.

He could smile, she realised, but not for her.

From beginning to end, she had been nothing but a colossal joke.

Gu Huaisheng was cruel. She swore she would never like him again.

After the true daughter of the Jiang family returned, Jiang Jingchunâ€™s heart turned to ashes. She calmly accepted the marriage that the Jiang family arranged for her.

But before the betrothal was finalised, Gu Huaisheng appeared at her family residenceâ€™s doorstep.

On a day of heavy rain, he stood in the downpour under an umbrella, gripping her delicate wrist and refusing to let go. He said, â€œHe is not a good man.â€

Jiang Jingchun laughed and shook off his hand. â€œHe is still far kinder than you, Cousin.â€

Under Jiang Jingchunâ€™s icy gaze, Gu Huaisheng tensed up. A sharp ache spread through his chest.

For the first time, the proud and aloof young marquis understood what it truly meant to feel regret.

item.title: The Foolish General's Mute Spouse
item.nameextend: ***In Broad Daylight...***
item.description:
General Qi Ren, known as the â€œMad Wolfâ€ was once an undefeated war god. However, he was poisoned by an enemy spy on the battlefield, which left him mentally impaired, leading to the tragic downfall of a legendary hero. The Emperor, relieved to have neutralized this formidable threat to his throne, felt a twinge of guilt. Hearing rumors that the â€œmadmanâ€ harbored affection for the timid and mute Seventh Prince, Fu Yuâ€™an, the Emperor decided to arrange their marriage, believing it to be a benevolent gesture.

However, after the wedding, Fu Yuâ€™an, who had to play both father and mother to the seemingly foolish general, was shocked when he saw the â€œmadmanâ€ climbing into his bed with clear, calculating eyes. Fu Yuâ€™an kicked him off and exclaimed, â€œYouâ€™re not a fool?â€

To which Qi Ren retorted, â€œAnd youâ€™re not mute, are you? Weâ€™re both hiding our true selvesâ€”so why the disdain?â€

â€œâ€¦â€

item.title: After Rebirth, I Married my Archenemy
item.volume: Volume 2: A Blade Drawn on the Bowstring
item.nameextend: ***She could have avoided getting involved***
item.description:
Before her death, Qun Qing hated the powerful official Lu Huating the most. She hated him for assisting the new emperor and for being cunning and insidious. She thought about him day and night, and tried her best to defeat him, but she was not his match. In the end, she became a cannon fodder in his hands.

After Qun Qing died, she saw the princess of the fallen country that she had protected with her life, crying and leaning on the new emperorâ€™s chest: â€œQung Qing is dead, what should I do?â€
The new emperor kissed her: â€œYou will be fine, just love me.â€
The princess burst into tears, like a delicate flower under the rain: â€œQung Qing is dead, Your Majesty is all I have left.â€

When she opened his eyes, Qun Qing had woke up three years ago. She stood up, woodenly packed her bags, and regardless of the princessâ€™s obstruction, took off her jade crown and walked away, dropped her female officialâ€™s wooden seal, turned around and left, leaving behind ten years of careful planning and treading on thin ice.

Restore the country? Pfft, restore it my foot.
â€”â€”

The powerful minister Lu Huating is deeply cunning, ruthless, and dominates the power struggles of the court. Tired of the ugly nature of human hearts, his life has become dull and unfulfilling.

Looking back on his life, the only thing that left an impression was a female officer, a spy, whom he poisoned to death at the age of twenty-six.

For the love of the princess, she sacrificed his life for the country and schemed against him several times. In the end, she knelt in front of the Summer Palace, her facial expression remaining unchanged, with a look of resentment in her eyes, and sighed with a smile, â€œThe king who wins is the ruler, and the one who loses is the defeated,â€ before raising her head and drinking to the last drop. Bl00d poured from her lips, a thin layer of vivid red.

When he opened his eyes again, Lu Huating returned to his twenty-three-year-old self.

Lu Huating looked at the documents under his command, and felt even more bored. He put down his brush and leaned on the back of the chair: â€œWhere is the female official accompanying Crown Princess?â€

â€œâ€¦ She resigned. She asked me to tell My lord that she would not fight anymore.â€

Lu Huating was silent for a while, and curled his lips coldly: â€œShe said she wonâ€™t fight, so the fight is over?â€

item.title: The White Moonlight Disdained by the Male Protagonist of Redemption
item.nameextend: ***â€œSheâ€™s hereâ€¦ Who Is She?â€***
item.description:
Ning Yao died tragically.
 The man she had saved and cared for for many years despised her and shattered her spirit veins with his own hands and dissolved her body.
Ning Yao: â€œThank you. I have waited for this day.â€
Ning Yao is from the ancient Bodhi clan, kind by nature but without a heart.
 One year, she rescued a demon from the hands of the immortal Xuanmen, who was tortured and dying. She took good care of him, curing his years of illness and scars.
 She did not mind his humble status and liked him wholeheartedly, always smiling, hugging, and kissing him.
 Every time at that moment, Feng Jingzhuo felt pity and helplessness, and his love deepened.
 Little Bodhi (Ning Yao) cured his disabled and ugly body and cured his inferiority, self-loathing, sensitivity, and paranoia.
 How could he not be infatuated and loyal and love her deeply?
 But what Feng Jingzhuo did not know was that according to the rules of the Bodhi clanâ€™s ascension, one must first save others to prove the truth and then die and be reborn before ascending.
 And Ning Yaoâ€™s lifelong wish is to ascend.
That year, the eldest sister failed to ascend to heaven, and before she and her brother-in-law retired to the world sweetly, she pointed out a clear path for Ning Yao:

â€œYao Yao, our Bodhi clan is too beloved. Who could bear to use us as a stepping stone for enlightenment?â€

â€œIf youâ€™re truly set on it, why not try that demon imprisoned by the immortal sect? Pfftâ€”those fools donâ€™t know his worth. Heâ€™s from the Cangyuan Dragon Clan.â€

â€œIf it works, great. If notâ€¦ well, you could always fall in love, just like I did.â€

Her elder sister revealed a secret about the Cangyuan Dragon Clan:

If they fall deeply enough in love, their hearts will grow scales to shield them from their emotions. When that happens, their instincts will turn against their beloved, giving rise to an uncontrollable urge to kill.
